I was getting nostalgic with a friend and mentioned the killing floor server I still play on... then realized that server is 11 years old and still going. Might as well use that as an excuse to leave a review since Killing Floor has earned it.

Purchased this game just for myself.  I honestly didn't understand it was specifically for online play and had no single-player campaign.  I still enjoy it, however, as a 10, 15, or 20 minute intense distraction, made all the more severe because of fighting solo. 

I would not recommend buying this game just for solo.

A solid co op survival shooter that emphasizes teamwork pretty well. The sequel is here on steam too for $10 more with more content but this one is much less computer intensive. Second game here:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/232090/Killing_Floor_2/?curator_clanid=32797243

Nach all den Jahren die dieses Spiel auf dem buckel hat, empfehle ich dieses Spiel immer noch, da es echt gut Gealtert ist. Wer keine grafischen h√∂chst Anspr√ºche hat kann sich hier durchaus einen runden soliden Zombie Shooter abgreifen. Die Community ist noch vorhanden (viele Server sind noch online und belebt). Meiner Meinung nach liefert Tripwire mit dem Spiel Killingfloor das Beste Zombie Spiel das √ºberhaupt am markt existiert, da definitiv hier das Augenmerk auf einen Wellen Basierten Zombie Shooter liegt, ohne Lootboxen und anderen Loot schnick schnack. Nat√ºrlich hat das Game auch DLC aber effektiv f√ºgen nur 3 st√ºck neue waffen hinzu, der rest dind Waffen skins oder Charakter modelle, also nichts was man zum Spielen essensiel ben√∂tigt.
Killing Floor is proof that a simple concept and dated graphics are enough, even in 2020. My favorite game to play with friends.

This game is everything you could want in a wave-based co-op game. Even though the game is getting older, the mechanics and challenging nature of the game make it timeless. The modding community is also alive and well, which makes it even more fun and rewarding to have your own custom server. I've spent so much of my life on this game and have zero regrets.

[h1][b]Killing Floor[/b][/h1]
A primeira vez que eu joguei Killing Floor foi na minha conta antiga, depois comprei na conta do meu pai e por fim quando criei essa conta comprei novamente.
killing Floor me rendeu muitas horas de jogo e √© um dos melhores jogos cooperativos que j√° joguei, al√© de ser extremamente dif√≠cil o que deixa o jogo ainda melhor.

Bons gr√°ficos considerando a √©poca, bom design, excelente trilha sonora, excelente jogabilidade, diversos estilos de personagem pra escolher, eventos que aconteciam todo ano e sempre incluindo conte√∫do novo a cada evento.

[b]Nota: [u]10/10[/u][/b]

MUITO BOM!
Comecei jogando a Franquia pelo "Killing Floor 2", mas numa promo√ß√£o peguei esse aqui.
Primeiro de tudo o custo-benef√≠cio √© muito bom, bem barato, extremamente leve pra rodar em qualquer PC, muito divertido, desafiador e necessita de um bom time pra conseguir ganhar o jogo.
A comunidade √© extremamente viva, com muitos players online, n√£o se preocupe em comprar e n√£o ter com quem jogar.
Pra mim o game possui 3 pontos negativos:
-Repetitivo (n√£o chega a ser um defeito, pois √© a proposta do game ser um modo horda)
-Poucas variedades de armas e chefes (apenas 1)
-Demora pra upar o level do personagem
Os pontos mais fortes realmente s√£o a Jogabilidade e ambienta√ß√£o do game, muito foda.
Tamb√©m possui centenas de conquistas, se voc√™ quiser fazer todas, boa sorte.

El juegos es entretenido, si bien cuesta "agarrarle la mano" al principio luego de unas cuantas partidas ya entiendes todo. El juego tambi√©n  es bastante dif√≠cil lo cual lo hace a√∫n mas entretenido y euf√≥rico, puede llegar a ser un poco repetitivo luego de haber jugado unas cuantas horas, pero si estas aburrido y quieres pasar una o dos horas jugando es una de la mejores opciones (Ideal para jugar con amigos ).
old and clunky, requires team mates with a pulse, but lots of fun

I like it more than Killing Floor 2 and L4D 1 and L4D 2 and World War Z and I like all of those too.

The graphics of Killing Floor 1 are bad compared to all of the above.I like the gameplay and different classes in KF1.

I like every one of those games and think you should try them all if you into zombie shooters.

Just look at a video of KF1 and see if you think you can look past the old graphics and if you can than you should buy it on a steam deal.

You cant be a zombie or bad guy in this game but it is still fun killing the dead.It still has players who play online for MP.

Fighting the boss is always fun and usually hard unless you blow him up.

6 players on 1/2 maps camping 24/7 You can win be actually going AFK the entire match.Unavoidable damage without specific classes and what feels like abuse of wonky mechanics   Holidays the monsters are dressed up goofy   Deal with it or dont play the game during those times.Only 2 classes sharpshooter and commando require skill every other class is decision making.The game is heavily focused on beserker and medics since all the unavoidable/hard to avoid damage.Both classes take extremely less damage and can immedilty recover.Darkness with only some guns having flashlights so everyone turns gamma to max and dlc guns are p2w.Spam pipebombs on the boss to instant kill
The gameplay FEEL is amazing in the same way doom4/eternal or god of war 2 feels but shallow once you are experienced with the systems
Worth for 10$ if you buy games like uncharted or gears of war which dont have heavy replay value >At its core<

My first impression was during my first games...this game is not terrible and I had left it aside.

A few years later I got back into it a bit seriously after playing "Left 4 Dead 2".

Well...I realize that "Killing Floor" is much better and its community too...certainly it lacks a versus but there are three game modes that I let you discover.

The problem in my region there are too few servers and my internet connection is too bad for the moment (too many pings).

Too many DLCs that are too expensive...some are needed for achievements...

This game is full of good little surprises well hidden in the maps quite to choose rather choose "Killing Floor".
